data.title: Kansas State University
data.meta_description: Avery Johnson (2) Quarterback - CAREER HONORS • 2023 Pop-Tarts Bowl MVP • 2023 Honorable Mention Big 12 Offensive Freshman of the Year • 2023 National True F...
data.text:
CAREER HONORS

• 2023 Pop-Tarts Bowl MVP

• 2023 Honorable Mention Big 12 Offensive Freshman of the Year

• 2023 National True Freshman of the Week (Texas Tech – 247Sports, On3)

• 2023 Big 12 Newcomer of the Week (Texas Tech)

2023: Saw time in eight games with two starts – against TCU as one of two quarterbacks on the field to begin the game and his first-career true start at quarterback in the Pop-Tarts Bowl against NC State, a game in which he was named the MVP... Threw for 479 yards on the season with five touchdowns and no interceptions on 37-of-66 aim, while he rushed for 296 yards and seven touchdowns on 52 carries as he earned votes for the Big 12 Offensive Freshman of the Year award... His seven rushing touchdowns were the second most by a freshman in school history and tied for the most by a true freshman with Deuce Vaughn (2020)... Tied for second in rushing touchdowns among all true freshmen nationally in 2023, while he had the most among true freshmen quarterbacks... Just the fifth true freshman starting quarterback in school history, joining James Mack (1975), Duane Howard (1976), Josh Freeman (2006) and Will Howard (2020), while he was the second to start a bowl game (Freeman, 2006 Texas Bowl)... Led K-State to a victory in the Pop-Tarts Bowl, the first true freshman starting quarterback to earn a bowl victory... One of three true freshman quarterbacks to start a win and bowl game in 2023 (Duke’s Grayson Loftis and Tennessee’s Nico Iamaleava)... Threw for 178 yards and two touchdowns on 14-of-31 aim, while he added 71 rushing yards and a touchdown on seven carries in the bowl victory... His two passing touchdowns tied for sixth in school bowl history... Led K-State to a 38-21 victory at Texas Tech as he came off the bench to record five rushing touchdowns, tied for the most in school history for a single game with Collin Klein (2011 vs. Texas A&M) and Jonathan Beasley (2000 vs. North Texas)... It was the most rushing touchdowns by any true freshman since Oklahoma’s Samaje Perine also had five against Kansas in 2014, while it was the most by a true freshman quarterback since at least 1995 and the most ever by a Big 12 true freshman quarterback... Was one of only three players in the nation during the 2023 season with at least five rushing touchdowns in a game... His 30 points scored and five touchdowns scored at Texas Tech also tied a school records in those respective categories... Rushed for 90 yards against Texas Tech, one of three games in which he had 70 or more rushing yards (73 vs. TCU, 71 vs. NC State)... Also threw for 77 yards on 8-of-9 aim against the Red Raiders... Rushed for a touchdown against SEMO and threw touchdown passes against TCU, Houston and Baylor.

HIGH SCHOOL: Played at Maize under head coach Gary Guzman... Rated the 77th-best player overall in the Class of 2023 by ESPN, while Rivals ranked him as the top dual-threat quarterback in the class... Also rated No. 85 overall and No. 9 among quarterbacks by 247Sports... The top player in the state of Kansas for the Class of 2023 by 247Sports, ESPN and On3... Competed in the Elite 11 Finals in the summer of 2022, K-State’s first Elite 11 quarterback since Josh Freeman in 2005... Selected to play in the U.S. Army Bowl in Frisco, Texas, in addition to the Under Armour All-America Game in Orlando, Florida... Named the Kansas Gatorade Player of the Year and the MaxPreps Kansas Player of the Year in 2022... Selected as the 2022 Wichita Eagle Offensive Player of the Year in the state of Kansas, while the publication named him to its Top 11 team and a first team all-state performer... Also named a Top 11 player and first team all-state performer in 2022 by Sports in Kansas and KHSHAA Covered... Threw for 2,768 yards and 29 touchdowns with just three interceptions on 153-of-228 aim as a senior in addition to running for 817 yards and 15 scores on 98 carries, leading the Eagles to a 12-1 record and a sub-state championship... Named the league’s offensive MVP as a senior... A first team all-state performer as a junior from Sports in Kansas and the Wichita Eagle, the latter naming him one of the top 11 players in the state in 2021... Also competed in basketball and baseball.

PERSONAL: Avery Johnson was born November 2, 2004, in Wichita, Kansas... Son of Mark Johnson and Hope Dent... Has two siblings, Lauren and Anthony... Majoring in business administration.
